intro: Acinos sardous, commonly known as the Sardinian mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sardinia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale blue to white ray florets. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Acinos sardous is adapted to withstand harsh climates and is an important component of the local flora.
